description.narrative: The project will stage media awareness campaigns every year on citizens# rights and freedoms regarding security, reaching 85% of the population in targeted communities. The National Independent Human Rights Commission - CNIDH will start with the development of astrategy for the campaign, with participation of all consortium members and implementing partners to ensure that the campaign reinforces interventions under other outputs and is fed by experiences and lessons learnt by partners during the implementation of the programme. During the campaigns, CNIDH will use different materials including: spots radios, billboards, posters#. Equally radio programs will be produced. All those media materials will be broadcasted on RTNB (Radio Nationale du Burundi), a state-owned radio station and on other private radio stations (e.g. Radio Nderagakura, Radio Maria). They will also be posted on social media, and on the facebook page of the Commission. This campaign will coincide with grassroot awareness campaign that will be undertaken by community structures with the support of partners based in province (MIPAREC, OAP and CEJP). To ensure coherence of the awareness campaign on human rights related to peace and security, the CNIDH will make sure that the messages to be developed are based on the relevant Burundian laws and regulations in the area of peace and security as identified by the Burundi Leadership Training Program - BLTP . The project will also expand the response capacity of the protection hotline of CNIDH. The Commission # CNIDH will conduct awareness raising campaign about the protection-hotline, broadcasting radio sports per campaign, disseminating posters and leaflets to facilitate incoming reports. CNIDH will conduct monitoring of cases reported through the hotline and case manage at least 400 individual protection cases. The expanded capacity of the protection hotline enables the CNIDH to increase their quantity and quality of their case management. Due to their mandate, the CNIDH is able to intervene in politically highly sensitive cases. Data obtained through the hotline will serve as inputs to provincial and national reports to be produced by Oxfam in close collaboration with the CNIDH and other implementing partners. A statistician will conduct a statistical analysis to highlight the recurrent violations and their geographic location, producing a map of incidents and violations, showing high risk areas that require urgent response (early warning). Consolidated reports are shared with key actors, discussed in private and presented in provincial human rights forums and communal jointplatforms. Finally , the program will also revitalize and expand 3 provincial accountability and responsiveness platforms (CNIDH-run Human Rights Forums) wherecommunity structures, churches, security services and authorities meet and deliberate safely in a process of mutual accountability on the outcomes of the monitoring reports and for the implementation of the peace and security plans andthe follow up on referred actions on security threats. These existing (although not everywhere active) and officially recognized forums that are facilitated by the CNIDH are appropriate spaces to attract higher level authorities (provincial; ministry level). The CNIDH willfacilitate at least 5 forums per province over the course of the programme attracting 50 people per session, including representatives of community structures and authorities at commune, province and national level.

participating-org.narrative: CNIDH (Commission Nationale Indépendante des droits de l#homme) is a semi-State institution, a human rights institution mandated with the promotion and the protection of human rights. Its vision is #Burundi is a state that respects human rights, promotes positivemoral and cultural values and has institutions guided by a human rights-based approach#. The mandate of CNIDH is: -receive complaints and investigate violations of human rights; - conduct regular, announced or unannounced visits to all detention centers and make recommendations to competent authorities with a view to improving the treatment and conditions of persons under detention - prevent torture and other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment ; - combat rape and gender-based violence; - provide legal assistance to victims of human rights violations, - conduct information and awareness campaigns on human rights throughout the country;- participate in the development and implementation of human rights education programs; - provide advice, recommendations and suggestions to the Government, the Parliament, etc. CNIDH has been a partner of Oxfam Burundi in the implementation of a EU project on elections from 2015 to 2016 where it proved to be a strategic partner when it comes to engaging State authorities on respect of humanrights and capacity building in human rights for State institutions. In this ARC # Nyubahiriza program, CNIDH is given a niche rolebased on its expertise and mandate. As such CNIDH will conduct human rights monitoring, raise awareness and build capacity of State and provincial authorities in human rights.
